> EGD: 30 Tonne Cranes

EGD: 30 Tonne Cranes

Effective the end of business day Wednesday November 17 the Ebco crane will be taken out of service permanently on the South Side of the basin dock. The Ebco crane will then be dismantled in an area in front (north) of the South Side Electrical Sub Station. The work area for the dismantling will be cordoned off with no access to people, vehicles etc other than those personnel working on the project. The pieces of the Ebco crane will be lowered into dock bottom via a heavy lift mobile crane stationed adjacent to the Ebco crane. The pieces will subsequently then be picked up by the EGD 150 tonne Krupp crane from dock bottom and then transferred to the work area on the North Landing Wharf. It is estimated that the dismantling portion of this project will take approximately 6 weeks with scheduled complete dismantling and transfer of the crane blocks to take until Christmas time, 2010. Once the crane blocks are located on the North Landing Wharf the refurbishment of the Ebco crane blocks will occur and then the Ebco crane will then be re-erected on the North Side of the basin dock in an area in front of the EGD Pump House. The re-erection is scheduled to occur in March, 2011 with the Ebco project to be back in service approximately at the end of March, 2011.

Regarding the new Konecrane on the South Side of the basin dock, it is anticipated that this new 30 tonne crane will be in service on the South Side approximately during the week of December 6, 2010. Due to the Ebco dismantling occurring in front of the South Side Electrical Sub Station the new Konecrane will be limited in its easterly movement by the Ebco dismantling. The new Konecrane will travel from this point west to the mouth of the basin dock. Following the complete dismantling of the Ebco crane and its removal from the South Side of the basin dock, the new Konecrane will then have the full east to west movement on the south side.

I apologize for any inconvenience that this work may cause our clients and I request that all of our clients "bear with us" this inconvenience until these exciting projects are completed. We are working towards providing the best possible service that we can provide to our clients and with the installation and bringing into service of the new Konecrane and the modernization and refurbishment of our current Ebco crane we are in fact accomplishing that.

Regards,

David A. Latoski
Operations Manager
Esquimalt Graving Dock
